Cover with another slice of bread, cut in half, and serve.

fruitSandwich.name: Fruit Sandwich
steps: Spread whipped cream on one slice of bread.
Layer assorted sliced fruits on top.
Cover with the other slice of bread, press gently, and slice to serve.

tonkatsu.name: Tonkatsu
steps: Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper.
Dredge each cutlet in flour, dip in beaten egg, then coat with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry cutlets until golden and cooked through.
Slice and serve with tonkatsu sauce.

katsuCurry.name: Katsu Curry
steps: Season and bread pork cutlets as in tonkatsu.
Fry until golden and cooked through, then set aside.
In a pot, sauté onion until translucent, then add carrots and potatoes.
Pour in water and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Add curry roux and stir until dissolved.
Serve curry over sliced katsu.

chawanmushi.name: Chawanmushi
steps: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, dashi, soy sauce, and salt.
Add shrimp and mushrooms, then strain the mixture into cups.
Steam in a steamer for 15-20 minutes until set.
Garnish with green onions and serve warm.

yakiniku.name: Yakiniku
ingredients: Vegetables for grilling (e.g., bell peppers, onions)
steps: Marinate beef in soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and garlic for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat grill or grill pan.
Grill beef and vegetables until cooked to your liking.
Serve with rice.

nabe.name: Nabe
steps: In a nabe pot, combine dashi stock, soy sauce, and mirin.
Add chicken, napa cabbage, tofu, and mushrooms.
Bring to a boil and simmer until ingredients are cooked.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

mochi.name: Mochi
ingredients: Sweet red bean paste or ice cream (for filling)
steps: Soak glutinous rice in water overnight.
Drain and steam the rice until cooked and sticky.
Pound the rice until it becomes a smooth dough.
Dust hands and work surface with cornstarch, then flatten the dough.
Place a small amount of sweet filling in the center and fold the dough over.
Shape into balls and dust with cornstarch before serving.

dorayaki.name: Dorayaki
steps: In a bowl, beat eggs and sugar until fluffy.
Sift in flour and baking powder, and mix until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour a small amount of batter to form pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Sandwich red bean paste between two pancakes and serve.

dango.name: Dango
steps: Mix glutinous rice flour and sugar in a bowl.
Gradually add water and knead until smooth.
Shape into small balls and boil until they float.
Skewer the dango on sticks and grill briefly if desired.
Serve with soy sauce for dipping.

taiyaki.name: Taiyaki
ingredients: Sweet red bean paste or custard (for filling)
steps: Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk egg and water together, then combine with dry ingredients.
Heat a taiyaki pan and pour batter into fish-shaped molds.
Add filling, cover with more batter, and cook until golden brown.
Remove and serve warm.

matchaIceCream.name: Matcha Ice Cream
steps: In a bowl, whisk together sugar and matcha powder.
In a saucepan, heat cream and milk until warm, then add the matcha mixture.
In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolk, then slowly add a bit of the warm mixture.
Combine all and heat until slightly thickened.
Chill in the fridge, then churn in an ice cream maker.

anmitsu.name: Anmitsu
ingredients: 1 cup fruit (like melon, strawberries, or peaches)
steps: Prepare agar-agar according to package instructions and let it set.
Cut the agar into cubes and arrange in a bowl.
Add sweet red bean paste and chopped fruit.
Drizzle with black syrup and top with matcha ice cream if desired.

kakigori.name: Kakigori
ingredients: Flavored syrup (like strawberry, green tea, or lemon)
steps: Shave or crush ice and pack it into a bowl.
Pour flavored syrup over the ice.
Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk if desired, and serve immediately.

shiratama.name: Shiratama
steps: Mix glutinous rice flour with water to form a dough.
Shape into small balls and boil until they float.
Let cool, then fill with sweet red bean paste.
Dust with matcha powder before serving.

zoni.name: Zoni
steps: Heat dashi broth in a pot and add carrots and mushrooms.
Simmer until tender, then add mochi.
Once mochi is soft, add greens and season with soy sauce and salt.
Serve hot in bowls.

okonomiyaki.name: Okonomiyaki
steps: In a large bowl, mix flour and dashi broth until smooth.
Add cabbage, green onions, pickled ginger, and eggs to the mixture.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a little oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter into the skillet and spread it into a circle.
Layer sliced pork belly on top and cook for about 5-7 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 5-7 minutes until cooked through.
Drizzle with okonomiyaki sauce and mayonnaise, then sprinkle with aonori and katsuobushi before serving.

shabuShabu.name: Shabu Shabu
steps: In a pot, bring dashi broth to a boil.
Add napa cabbage, shiitake mushrooms, and tofu to the pot.
Once the vegetables are tender, dip slices of beef into the boiling broth until cooked (about 5-10 seconds).
Serve with ponzu sauce and sesame sauce for dipping.

nikujaga.name: Nikujaga
steps: In a pot, sauté onions until translucent.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Add potatoes and carrots, then pour in dashi broth, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender (about 20 minutes).
Season with salt to taste and serve hot.

yakiTori.name: Yaki Tori
steps: Soak skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, sake, mirin, and sugar to create a marinade.
Thread chicken pieces and green onions onto skewers.
Marinate skewers for 15 minutes.
Grill over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally and basting with marinade.

chirashiSushi.name: Chirashi Sushi
steps: Rinse sushi rice until water runs clear, then cook with water in a rice cooker.
In a bowl, mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved.
Once rice is cooked, fluff with a fork and mix in the vinegar mixture.
Transfer rice to a serving dish, then top with sashimi, cucumber, carrot, and seaweed.

sabaShioyaki.name: Saba Shioyaki
steps: Sprinkle salt on the saba fillets and let sit for 15 minutes.
Preheat a grill or broiler.
Grill fillets skin-side down for about 5-7 minutes until cooked through.
Serve with lemon and shredded daikon.

gomokuGohan.name: Gomoku Gohan
steps: Rinse and soak rice for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, combine rice and water, and bring to a boil.
Add mushrooms, carrot, and chicken, along with soy sauce, mirin, and sugar.
Cover and simmer on low heat until rice is cooked (about 15-20 minutes).
Fluff and serve.

misoKatsu.name: Miso Katsu
steps: Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and fry cutlets until golden brown (about 4-5 minutes per side).
In a separate pot, combine miso paste, mirin, and sugar, and heat until smooth.
Serve cutlets drizzled with miso sauce.

gazpacho.name: Gazpacho
steps: Chop tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and garlic.
Blend all ingredients with tomato juice until smooth.
Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, then chill before serving.

tortillaEspañola.name: Tortilla Española
steps: Peel and thinly slice potatoes and onion.
Heat olive oil in a skillet and sauté potatoes and onion until soft.
Beat eggs in a bowl and add the potato mixture.
Pour back into the skillet and cook until set.
Flip to cook both sides and serve.

paella.name: Paella
steps: Heat olive oil in a paella pan and brown the chicken.
Add onion, garlic, and bell pepper, and sauté until soft.
Stir in rice and saffron, then pour in chicken broth.
Add shrimp and cook without stirring until rice is tender.
Let rest before serving.

flan.name: Flan
steps: In a saucepan, melt sugar until caramelized and pour into flan mold.
In a bowl, mix eggs, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla.
Pour the mixture into the mold and bake in a water bath at 350°F (175°C) for 50 minutes.
Cool before flipping onto a plate.

empanadas.name: Empanadas
steps: Mix flour, butter, and water to form a dough, then chill.
Sauté onion until soft, then add ground beef and cook through.
Roll out dough, cut into circles, and fill with beef mixture.
Fold and seal, then bake until golden.

salmorejo.name: Salmorejo
steps: Blend tomatoes, olive oil, bread crumbs, garlic, vinegar, and salt until smooth.
Chill before serving.
Garnish with chopped hard-boiled eggs.

pimientosRellenos.name: Pimientos Rellenos
steps: Cook rice and set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic, then add ground meat until browned.
Mix in cooked rice and tomato sauce, then stuff into halved bell peppers.
Bake until peppers are tender.

pulpoGallego.name: Pulpo a la Gallega
steps: Boil the octopus in salted water for about 40 minutes until tender.
Remove and let cool, then slice into pieces.
Boil the potatoes until soft, then slice them.
Arrange the potato slices on a plate, top with octopus slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt.

bacalao.name: Bacalao al Pil-Pil
steps: Soak the cod in water for 24 hours, changing the water frequently.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic until golden.
Add cod and cook gently, stirring until the oil emulsifies.
Season with chili flakes and parsley before serving.

salmonConPimientos.name: Salmon con Pimientos
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté sliced onion until soft.
Add sliced bell peppers and cook until tender.
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then place on top of vegetables.
Cover and cook for about 10 minutes until salmon is cooked through.

pisto.name: Pisto
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté onion and bell pepper until softened.
Add zucchini and cook until tender.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until thickened.
Fry the eggs sunny-side up and serve on top of the pisto.

bacalaoVizcaina.name: Bacalao a la Vizcaína
steps: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onions and garlic until translucent.
Add chopped bell peppers and cook until softened.
Stir in tomatoes and paprika, cooking until saucy.
Add the soaked cod and cover with water.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes until the fish is tender.
Season with salt to taste before serving.

pimientosDePadron.name: Pimientos de Padrón
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add Padrón peppers and sauté until blistered and slightly charred.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with sea salt.
Serve warm as a tapas dish.

cocido.name: Cocido
steps: In a large pot, combine soaked chickpeas, beef, chorizo, and onion.
Cover with water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until meat is tender.
Add carrots and potatoes, cooking until soft.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.

tartaDeSantiago.name: Tarta de Santiago
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix almond flour, sugar, eggs, lemon zest, and cinnamon until combined.
Pour batter into a greased tart pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden.
Let cool and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

chistorra.name: Chistorra
steps: In a bowl, combine ground pork, bacon, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Mix until well combined.
Stuff mixture into natural casings, tying off at intervals.
Cook in a skillet over medium heat until browned and cooked through.
Serve hot with bread or in a sandwich.

meze.name: Meze
ingredients: Hummus, baba ghanoush, stuffed grape leaves, and various dips
steps: Prepare various dips like hummus and baba ghanoush.
Serve with pita bread, olives, and cheese on a platter.
Enjoy as an appetizer or side dish.

dolma.name: Dolma
steps: Sauté onion in olive oil until translucent.
Mix rice, tomatoes, pine nuts, salt, and pepper into the onion.
Place a spoonful of filling in each grape leaf and roll tightly.
Arrange in a pot, add water, and simmer for 30-40 minutes.

pide.name: Pide
steps: Mix flour, water, yeast, and salt to form a dough.
Let rise for 1 hour.
Shape dough into oval boats and add desired toppings.
Bake in a preheated oven until golden.

baklava.name: Baklava
steps: Layer phyllo sheets in a baking dish, brushing each with melted butter.
Chop and sprinkle nuts between layers.
Cut into diamond shapes before baking at 350°F (175°C) until golden.
Prepare syrup with sugar, water, and vanilla; pour over hot baklava.

kumpir.name: Kumpir
steps: Bake potatoes until soft.
Cut open and fluff the insides with butter and cheese.
Add desired toppings and serve immediately.

simit.name: Simit
steps: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, and salt; gradually add water to form a dough.
Shape into rings and dip in a water-sugar solution, then in sesame seeds.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) until golden.

lahmacun.name: Lahmacun
steps: Prepare dough with flour and water; let rise.
Mix ground meat with onion, tomatoes, spices, and salt.
Roll out dough and spread meat mixture on top.
Bake until crispy.

mercimekCorbasi.name: Mercimek Çorbası
steps: Sauté onion in a pot until translucent.
Add carrots, potato, lentils, and broth.
Simmer until lentils are soft; blend until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper, serve with lemon.

imamBayildi.name: İmam Bayıldı
steps: Halve eggplants and scoop out some flesh.
Sauté onion, garlic, and tomatoes in olive oil; mix with eggplant flesh.
Fill eggplant halves with the mixture and bake at 350°F (175°C) until tender.

kuzu tandir.name: Kuzu Tandır
steps: Season lamb with salt, pepper, and thyme.
Place in a pot with onion and garlic; add water to cover.
Slow-cook for several hours until tender; serve with rice.

yufka.name: Yufka
steps: Mix flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Roll out thinly and cook on a hot griddle until lightly browned.
Use for wraps or as a side.

sahandaEgg.name: Sahanda Egg
steps: Sauté onion in butter until soft.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
Crack eggs over the mixture, season with salt and pepper, and cook until set.

cilbir.name: Çılbır (Poached Eggs with Yogurt)
steps: In a bowl, mix yogurt with minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer and poach the eggs for about 3-4 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
In a small pan, melt butter and add paprika. Cook until fragrant.
Place the garlic yogurt on a plate, top with the poached eggs, and drizzle with the paprika butter.
Garnish with fresh dill and serve warm with bread.

kisir.name: Kısır (Bulgur Salad)
steps: Place bulgur in a bowl and pour hot water over it. Cover and let sit for 15 minutes until the bulgur absorbs the water.
Fluff the bulgur with a fork and add chopped onion, tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, and mint.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, then season with salt and pepper.
Toss everything together until well combined.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

borek.name: Börek (Savory Pastry)
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix feta cheese, spinach, onion, and half of the beaten egg. Season with salt and pepper.
Layer phyllo dough sheets, brushing each layer with olive oil. Place the filling on one side and roll it up into a log.
Place the rolled börek on a baking sheet and brush with the remaining egg.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

manti.name: Mantı (Turkish Dumplings)
steps: In a bowl, mix flour, egg, and water to form a dough. Knead until smooth and let rest for 30 minutes.
In another bowl, mix ground meat, grated onion, salt, and pepper.
Roll out the dough thinly and cut into small squares. Place a small amount of filling in the center of each square.
Fold the squares into triangles and pinch the edges to seal.
Boil in salted water for about 10 minutes until cooked.
Serve with yogurt and sprinkle with paprika.

dondurma.name: Dondurma (Turkish Ice Cream)
ingredients: 1/2 cup salep (or cornstarch as a substitute)
steps: In a saucepan, mix milk, sugar, and cornstarch over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Add salep and stir constantly until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Stir in vanilla extract.
Pour into a container and freeze for at least 6 hours.
Once frozen, stir every hour for the first 4 hours to achieve a creamy texture.
Serve scoops topped with crushed pistachios.

asado.name: Asado
ingredients: Various cuts of beef (ribs, flank steak, sirloin, etc.)
steps: Prepare a fire using wood or charcoal. Let the fire burn down until the coals are glowing red with a layer of ash.
Generously season the cuts of beef with coarse salt on all sides.
Place the meat on the grill (parrilla) over indirect heat, making sure the coals are evenly distributed.
Slowly cook the meat, turning it occasionally to ensure even cooking. The goal is a low, slow roast to make the meat tender and flavorful.
Add sausages to the grill in the final 15-20 minutes of cooking.
Serve the meat hot with chimichurri sauce on the side, if desired.

chimichurri.name: Chimichurri
steps: In a medium bowl, combine the parsley, garlic, and oregano.
Slowly whisk in olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Add red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, adjusting to taste.
Allow the chimichurri to rest for at least 30 minutes before serving to let the flavors meld together.
Serve over grilled meats or as a dipping sauce.

milanesa.name: Milanesa
steps: Season the cutlets with salt, pepper, minced garlic, and chopped parsley. Let them marinate for 15-30 minutes.
Set up a breading station with flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs in separate shallow bowls.
Dredge each cutlet in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and finally coat in breadcrumbs. Press the breadcrumbs to ensure an even coating.
Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Fry the breaded cutlets in batches, cooking for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with lemon wedges.

provoleta.name: Provoleta
ingredients: 1 round of provolone cheese (about 1 inch thick)
steps: Heat a grill or heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Brush the provolone round with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano and red pepper flakes.
Place the cheese on the hot grill or pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom is golden and crispy, and the cheese starts to melt but still holds its shape.
Carefully flip the cheese and cook for another 2-3 minutes on the other side.
Serve immediately, either plain or topped with chimichurri sauce.

matambre_a_la_pizza.name: Matambre a la Pizza
steps: Preheat a grill or oven to medium heat.
Season the flank steak with salt and pepper, and grill or bake until cooked through (about 10-15 minutes depending on thickness).
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the cooked steak.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese, oregano, basil, and red pepper flakes over the top of the sauce.
Return the steak to the grill or oven and cook until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Slice the matambre like a pizza and serve hot.

carbonada.name: Carbonada
ingredients: 1 can peaches (drained and cut into slices)
steps: In a large pot, sauté the onion and bell pepper until softened.
Add the cubed beef and brown on all sides.
Add the diced potato, sweet potato, corn, and bay leaf. Pour in the beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Lower the heat and cook for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
Add the peach slices in the last 10 minutes of cooking.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, and serve the carbonada hot.

humita.name: Humita
ingredients: 6 ears of corn (grated or processed into a coarse mixture)
1/2 cup crumbled fresh cheese (e.g., queso fresco)
steps: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft and translucent.
Add the grated corn to the skillet and stir to combine. Season with salt, pepper, and sugar, and cook over low heat, stirring frequently.
Cook for about 15-20 minutes until the mixture thickens to a creamy consistency.
Stir in the crumbled cheese and cook for another 5 minutes.
Optionally sprinkle with paprika before serving. You can also wrap the mixture in corn husks and steam for a traditional presentation.

locro.name: Locro
steps: In a large pot, sauté the onion in a bit of oil until soft and translucent.
Add the cubed beef and chorizo, and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in the soaked beans, diced sweet potato, corn, paprika, cumin, and bay leaf.
Pour in the beef broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and the beans are cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve the locro hot, optionally with a sprinkle of paprika or a dollop of chimichurri.

alfajores.name: Alfajores
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
In a large bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolk and vanilla, and mix until combined.
Gradually add the cornstarch and flour, mixing until a soft dough forms.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to about 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into small circles using a cookie cutter.
Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.
Let the cookies cool completely, then sandwich together with dulce de leche.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

meatPie.name: Meat Pie
steps: In a pan, sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add ground beef, cooking until browned. Stir in beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F).
Line a pie dish with one sheet of pastry, fill with the meat mixture, and cover with the second sheet. Seal edges and make slits on top.
Brush with beaten egg and bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown.

poutine.name: Poutine
steps: Cook French fries according to package instructions.
Heat beef gravy until hot.
Place fries on a plate and top with cheese curds.
Pour hot gravy over the fries and cheese.
Serve immediately.

kungPaoChicken.name: Kung Pao Chicken
steps: Marinate the diced chicken with soy sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and stir-fry the dried chilies until they darken. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, stir-fry the chicken until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
Add garlic, ginger, and bell peppers to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add chicken back to the pan along with hoisin sauce, sugar, and chicken broth. Stir well.
Add the peanuts and cooked chilies, season with salt, and stir-fry for another minute.
Serve hot with rice.

arrozConPollo.name: Arroz Con Pollo
steps: Brown chicken in a pan and set aside.
Cook onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened.
Stir in rice, tomato sauce, and cumin.
Add chicken broth, saffron, and chicken.
Simmer until rice is cooked.
Stir in green peas and season with salt and pepper.

croissant.name: Croissant
steps: Mix flour, sugar, and yeast. Add warm milk and melted butter, then knead into a dough.
Let the dough rise until doubled in size.
Roll out dough and fold in chilled butter. Roll and fold several times to create layers.
Cut into triangles, roll up, and shape into croissants.
Let rise again and brush with egg wash.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 15-20 minutes until golden brown.
Cool before serving.

chickenSchnitzel.name: Chicken Schnitzel
steps: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and cook chicken until golden and cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges.

moussaka.name: Moussaka
steps: Fry eggplant slices in olive oil and set aside.
Cook lamb with onion and garlic, then add tomato sauce, wine, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Layer eggplant and lamb mixture in a baking dish.
Top with bechamel sauce and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.

goulash.name: Goulash
steps: Heat oil and brown beef cubes.
Add onion, garlic, and bell pepper and cook until softened.
Stir in paprika and caraway seeds.
Add tomato sauce and beef broth.
Simmer for 1 hour until beef is tender.
Season with salt and pepper.

carbonara.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, cook the pancetta or bacon until crispy. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Add garlic to the pan and sauté for 1 minute.
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan, then mix in the egg and cheese mixture quickly. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs.
Stir in the crispy pancetta and season with salt and black pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

sushi.name: Sushi
ingredients: Wasabi and pickled ginger for serving
steps: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Cook in a rice cooker with water.
Mix rice vinegar and sugar. Stir into cooked rice and cool.
Place rice on nori sheets and add fish slices.
Roll tightly and slice into pieces.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

babaGanoush.name: Baba Ganoush
steps: Roast eggplants until tender and charred. Cool and peel.
Blend eggplants with tahini, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and garnish with parsley.
Enjoy with pita bread or vegetables.

laksa.name: Laksa
steps: Cook chicken and set aside.
In a pot, cook laksa paste in coconut milk until fragrant.
Add chicken broth and fish sauce, then simmer.
Add noodles and cook until tender.
Top with chicken, bean sprouts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

tacos.name: Tacos
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for topping
steps: Cook ground beef with onion and garlic until browned.
Add taco seasoning and a splash of water. Simmer until well combined.
Fill taco shells with beef mixture and top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve immediately.

shakshuka.name: Shakshuka
steps: Heat oil and cook onion, garlic, and bell pepper until softened.
Add tomato sauce, cumin, paprika, and chili powder.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook until eggs are set.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with bread.

couscous.name: Couscous
steps: Bring water, olive oil, and salt to a boil.
Add couscous and remove from heat.
Cover and let sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and stir in raisins, almonds, and parsley.

jollofRice.name: Jollof Rice
steps: Cook onion, garlic, and bell pepper until softened.
Add tomato paste, diced tomatoes, thyme, and curry powder.
Add rice and broth, and simmer until rice is cooked.

ceviche.name: Ceviche
steps: Marinate fish in lime juice for 2 hours.
Mix with onion, tomato, cilantro, and jalapeño.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

chickenAdobo.name: Chicken Adobo
steps: Marinate chicken in soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and cook onions until soft.
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned.
Add water, bay leaves, and peppercorns.
Simmer until chicken is tender and sauce is reduced.
Serve with rice.

cabbageRolls.name: Cabbage Rolls
steps: Blanch cabbage leaves in boiling water until pliable.
Mix beef, rice, onion, and egg.
Place filling in cabbage leaves and roll up.
Place rolls in a baking dish.
Mix tomato sauce with brown sugar and pour over rolls.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.

beefStroganoff.name: Beef Stroganoff
steps: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion until soft. Add beef strips and cook until browned.
Add mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in beef broth and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

rakija.name: Rakija
steps: Mash plums and mix with sugar.
Add water and yeast, then ferment for 2 weeks.
Distill the mixture to produce rakija.

kimchi.name: Kimchi
steps: Cut cabbage into quarters and sprinkle with sea salt. Let sit for 2 hours.
Rinse cabbage thoroughly and drain.
Mix ginger, garlic, fish sauce, sugar, and red pepper flakes to make the paste.
Combine paste with cabbage, radish, and green onions.
Pack into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days.
Refrigerate and serve.

patatasBravas.name: Patatas Bravas
steps: Peel and cut potatoes into cubes.
Boil potatoes until slightly tender, then drain.
Heat olive oil in a pan and fry potatoes until crispy.
Sprinkle with paprika, cayenne, and salt.
Serve with garlic aioli.

padThai.name: Pad Thai
steps: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.
In a pan, cook shrimp until pink and set aside.
Scramble eggs in the same pan.
Add garlic and chili, then stir in fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar.
Add noodles, bean sprouts, and shrimp.
Toss with peanuts and green onions.
Serve with lime wedges.

kebap.name: Kebap
steps: Mix meat, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Skewer the marinated meat onto skewers.
Grill over medium-high heat until cooked through.
Serve with flatbread and salad.

beefWellington.name: Beef Wellington
steps: Sear beef in olive oil until browned on all sides.
Cook mushrooms, onion, and garlic until moisture is evaporated.
Spread mustard on beef and cool.
Wrap beef in prosciutto and mushroom mixture.
Wrap in puff pastry and brush with egg.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.

Fries.name: French Fries
steps: fry the potatoes in the oil
season it with the seasoning

pho.name: Pho
steps: Char onion and ginger in a hot pan until fragrant.
Add spices and beef broth. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain the broth and return to pot. Add beef slices and cook briefly.
Prepare rice noodles according to package instructions.
Serve hot broth over noodles with fresh herbs, bean sprouts, lime, chili, and fish sauce.

pavBhaji.name: Pav Bhaji
steps: Heat butter in a pan, add onions and sauté until soft and translucent.
Add tomatoes and bell peppers, cook until they soften and blend well.
Add mashed potatoes and mix everything together, ensuring no lumps.
Sprinkle pav bhaji masala and salt, and mix well. Cook for a few minutes until the flavors meld together.
Toast the pav with butter on a hot griddle until golden brown.
Serve hot pav bhaji with a dollop of butter and chopped onions.

biryani.name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Fresh coriander and mint leaves (for garnish)
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, biryani masala, and salt for 1 hour.
Cook the rice with whole spices until 80% done and set aside.
Heat ghee and fry onions until golden brown. Set aside half for garnish.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft, then add the marinated chicken and cook for 10 minutes.
Layer half the rice in a pot, add the chicken mixture, and top with the remaining rice.
Garnish with fried onions, coriander, and mint. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

chole_bhature.name: Chole Bhature
steps: In a pressure cooker, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Add chole masala and salt.
Add soaked chickpeas and enough water to cover them. Pressure cook for 4-5 whistles until soft.
Once done, mash some chickpeas for a thicker gravy. Garnish with coriander leaves.
In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, and salt. Knead into a soft dough with water. Let it rest for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll out into circles.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the rolled bhature until they puff up and turn golden brown.
Serve hot with chole.
